availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Grigsby Bullitt (McCracken County, KY, prov govt conv member, attorney)

body.p: McCracken County, KY, attorney, soldier, and provisional government convention member. Shelby County, Kentucky, native.Son of Cuthbert Bullitt and Harriett Willett Bullett. Studied at Shelby College and South Hanover College in Indiana. Studied law with his brother, Willett Bullitt, of New Albany, Indiana. Attorney in New Albany, Indiana, in 1850. Attorney in Calhoun, Kentucky, from 1854 to 1858. Attorney in Paducah in 1860. Served in the 6th Kentucky Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.) as major. Captured at Cheshire, Ohio, on July 20, 1863. Prisoner of war at Depot near Sandusky, Ohio from July 28, 1863, to August 1, 1863. Prisoner of war

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Indiana, Floyd County, New Albany, p. 327A
